review_title: Not bad, I enjoy where I work
job_title: Registered Nurse in Atlantic City, NJ
pros:
Employee retention is pretty good.
Nurse burnout is not too high compared to other hospitals I've worked before but we are very busy. Co workers on my unit work well together as a team. 
Most staff are friendly & helpful.
Benefits are great
I choose my own schedule but weekends & holidays are pre selected
Work/Life balance is great.
Bonuses offered to pick up shifts.
403B offered
Tuition reimbursement 
Many opportunities for growth
Able to easily transfer to other units.
cons:
The pay needs to be more competitive for all the work we do.
Needs to hire more staff
Nurse patient ratio often 1:6. On dayshift it's way too busy to have that many patients. 
Patient turnover is very quick. There is barely time to breathe between having a discharge and a new admission. 
I hate that most of the vitals machines & equipment in some rooms don't work properly.

review_title: Push more work and take money away
job_title: Physician Assistant in Egg Harbor Township, NJ

job_title: Emergency Room Technician in Pomona, NJ
pros:
Coworkers are positive and have adequate teamwork.
Annual Christmas bonus
cons: Many changes by upper management in last few years, the climate to employees and patients alike is on a rapid decline. It is clearer and clearer that every day the hospital cares only about money and not about people. Illogical choices made by administrators that have no sense of reality because they do not work with patients and have not for years, if ever. Company execs constantly do "walkthroughs" of the Emergency Department, but they come around 8am when the day has not really begun, and pretend we are overstaffed. They never come when we are really busy (i.e. every day after 11am). They do offer an annual christmas bonus, but withhold the entire amount if an employee does not keep up to date on every last "certification" (some of them hospital specific busywork that we have to repeat every year), or has not attended enough staff meetings (which are often 6am on your day off), and jump through other hoops. The hospital does unsafe things with regard to patient care, and especially in the emergency room, and when something dangerous happens, they ignore their ridiculous and dangerous regulations, fire an employee as a scapegoat, and then do nothing. The fact that this place is still Magnet designated is an absolute joke. Pay among multiple positions is also lower than career counterparts in any other healthcare system in south Jersey.

review_title: Very poor Human Resource Department; mostly hiring for part-time positions
job_title: Administrative Assistant in Egg Harbor Township, NJ
pros: If you are lucky enough to be hired for a FULL-TIME position, the benefits are good.  (However, good luck with getting full-time work, unless you are a physician or a nurse, at AtlantiCare.  It seemed to me that all they hire is part-time so they do not have to give any benefits.
cons: Human Resource Department - especially interviewers -- is just bad.  During my interview, the person conducting the interview kept looking at her cell phone and eventually started texting. She seemed totally distracted and was not professional at all while interviewing me.  She told me I would hear back from her within 2 weeks whether or not I got the position.  Two weeks turned into three, then four . . . needless to say, I had to finally call her and she told me that she still did not know anything.  To me, this showed a total lack of professionalism, and I couldn't help  but wonder how she even got hired to work at AtlantiCare -- and as an interviewer in HR no less.

job_title: Staff Pharmacist in Atlantic City, NJ
pros: good benefits, good coworkers, great doctors,
cons: poor leadership managers belittle staff

job_title: Patient Access Associate in Atlantic City, NJ
pros: Benefit package is good. Good work-life balance
cons: Horrible pay, senior management is horrible.

job_title: in Atlantic City, NJ
pros: Health benefits and salary ok    Tuition reimbursement offered but its conditional upon doing a lot of extra work/joining no committees that you have no time for (because you are actually in school and working for them) and Then You have to try and receive the tuition money from an extremely rude woman who has been working there forever and makes it as difficult as possible to get through the process as if it's her money she's giving out
cons: Do not hire any Outsiders into Leadership roles: not one male or even a physician in leadership position.  Operated by a group of old nurses who have lost touch with the difficulties of taking care of patients.  Budget constraints outweigh patient safety and staffing ratios.

job_title: Office Representative in Atlantic City, NJ
pros:
-Benefits (health/dental insurance, 403B) are the best! Payroll deduction for low cost legal advice, Supplimental Life Ins., Healthcare Spending Account.
-Job security. Two hospitals, satellite facilities for Urgent Care after hours, Behavioral Health, Childcare, Women's health, Life Center (gym) and Obesity clinic. We just broke ground for the newest Cancer treatment center.
- Atlanticare is always looking for ways to grow.
- Pays up to 80% of the education costs for job-related education classes.
-Wellness/ preventive illness is a mission of AtlantiCare, an outreach for the community and my family.
-Employee healthcare, the utmost importance.
cons: There are no downsides. We are constantly growing and employee physical and mental health is taken quite seriously.

review_title: Is not loyal to long term employees.
job_title: Registered Nurse in Pomona, NJ
pros: Working at the bedside giving direct patient care.  Loyal to direct care givers and patients.  Working with a excellent group of skilled direct care providers.
cons: Micromanagement.  Middle and upper management never has time for you.  Only have time for the employee for disciplinary actions.  Upper and middle management over the last ten years forgot about the employee and patient.  It was what award you were aiming for.  It's great to get an award but at what price letting long term employee go.

job_title: RN BSN in Atlantic City, NJ
pros: christmas bonus, decent benefits (cost more every year)
cons: Staff somewhat 'click-ish'.  Hard to believe this is a magnet hospital.  I was inpatient for a week and found some of the RN's to be very lacking in basic knowledge.  Its sad that I was a patient had to tell them how to perform my care.  I felt if I was there another day they would kill me!  Management is clueless, they excel at having meetings and luncheons and locking themselves in their office to eat and talk on the phone.  Staff needs come last.  The focus is on customer service and  making money - not on quality care or living up too magnet standards.

job_title: PCU Technician in Bernville, PA
pros: Atlanticare remains very loyal to their employee's ; they also offer  many opportunities to grow professionally.  ACMC has been recognized  for the following awards : Nursing Magnet Award Designation ,Cardiac Care Excellence Award, and a recipient of the Malcolm Balbridge Award. I am extremely proud to have been a part of their medical team !
cons: They only offer 12.5 hr shifts. At times when the census is high it can be extremely overwhelming, to provide excellent patient on minimal sleep.

review_title: Extraordinary year translates in to a 2% raise

cons: The lifers that ride status quo are hindrance on everyone. All staff should keep their skills and methods current and sharp. New team members should not be the only ones to bring new ideas.
